channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping at southern end of Stroud Green Road, 6th October
item.description:
Even worse fly tipping than usual outside Dotori at the bottom of Seven Sisters Road including an oven and a fridge. This spot is constantly used for fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Stroud Green Road, Stroud Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees, 6th October
item.description:
I had previously reported trees on this street under 6044960 the trees are very low scratching cars etc. it doesn’t appear the works under the previous report were carried out. We have had multiple cars and bikes stolen here in the past year and visibility and lighting is crucial and the trees are adversely affecting this. Please can this be treated as a priority given the previous report being closed without appropriate action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Phoenix Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Offenham Road, Elmstead, London

item.title: Constant flytipping, 6th October
item.description:
People drive from all over to flytip here 24/7 and it's a mess that spills onto the pavements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mayfield Road, Ponders End, London

item.title: Overhanging trees and ivy, 6th October
item.description:
Osterly Close. Ivy is breaking fence.Branches fall in garden( have broken ornaments).Sap on washing. Constant leaves and samaras.Neefs clearing every other day. Drains are being blocked.Samaras turn I to weeds that are damaging my fake grass. I was told in a former e mail that every is responsible for own garden This is now ridiculous. Neighbours have same problems.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blythe Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This part of the Swingate Lane become flytiping hot-spot, 6th October
item.description:
Every week some criminal will dump his rubbish in this place. Council collects it from time to time, but doing nothing to prevent it just wasting our money. So please act on clean it and take preventive messures. Put up sign install cameras and punish culprits. Earn money for the council not waste it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swingate Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anti semetic grafitti again, 6th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Curtismill Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Flytipping on stairs AGAIN, 6th October
item.description:
I’m writing to report that there has been flytipping again on the stairs. This continues to be a recurring issue, which is both unpleasant and concerning for residents and anyone using the area. I’ve attached two photos for reference: • One taken today, 6th October 2025, • And another taken previously on 26th November 2025 (to show the ongoing nature of the problem). It’s disappointing to see this happening repeatedly, and I hope action can be taken to prevent further dumping and keep the stairs clean and safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmdene Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin have overflowed and made a meds, 6th October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
